alert.note: Alert for Brantley (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pierce and central Brantley Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 542 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Fort Mudge, or 8 miles west of Nahunta, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blackshear, Patterson and Raybon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
